    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Marid</h1>Marids are capricious but powerful genies from the Plane of Water; among geniekind, they are rivaled in power only by the fiery efreet. Marids embody the strength of the ocean’s waves and currents, but they also have a gentler side, loving performance and art such as dancing, music, and storytelling.<br />Marids regard efreet with hostility but rarely encounter them in their native environment. They get along with djinn, jann, and shaitans, although the latter consider marids flighty and annoying, associating only long enough to close trade deals. Marid society has strict rules of hospitality, and many marid cities have a magically sealed foreign quarter where marid shahzadas conduct business with air-breathers.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Elemental</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2">Arcana</a></u>, <u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 28<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=215">Marid</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 9</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Genie_Marid.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Genie_Marid.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Chaotic Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Neutral">CN</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Elemental Trait" class="trait" title="Elementals are creatures directly tied to an element and native to the Elemental Planes. Elementals don’t need to breathe."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=57">Elemental</a></span><span alt="Genie Trait" class="trait" title="The diverse families of genies hold positions of prominence on the Elemental Planes. They have powerful magical abilities."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=216">Genie</a></span><span alt="Water Trait" class="trait" title="Effects with the water trait either manipulate or conjure water. Those that manipulate water have no effect in an area without water. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of water or have a magical connection to the element."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=165">Water</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 165</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +18; darkvision, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=65"><i>detect alignment</i></a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a>, wavesense (imprecise) 60 feet<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=14"><u>Aquan</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +20 (+24 to swim), <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +16, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +19, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10"><u>Nature</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=12"><u>Performance</a></u> +16, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14"><u>Society</a></u> +14, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +18<br /><b>Str</b> +5, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> +1, <b>Wis</b> +3, <b>Cha</b> +3<br /><b>Items</b> <i>+1 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=45">trident</a></i><hr /><b>AC</b> 28, <b>Fort</b> +18, <b>Ref</b> +21, <b>Will</b> +17<br /><b>HP</b> 145; <b>Resistances</b> fire 10<br /><b>Vortex</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=165">water</a>) 40 feet. Water in the aura that is also in the same body of water as the marid is difficult terrain for Swimming creatures. Creatures with the water trait are immune.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet, swim 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>trident</i> +21 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+11 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +20 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188"><u>nonlethal</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d4+11 bludgeoning</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>trident</i> +21 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=195"><u>thrown 20 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+11 piercing</span><b>Arcane Innate Spells</b> DC 28; <b>7th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=222">plane shift</a></u></i> (at will; to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only); <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=51">control water</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=145">hallucinatory terrain</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=154">hydraulic push</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=155">hydraulic torrent</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=290">solid fog</a></u></i>; <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=28">blur</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=160">illusory object</a></u></i>; <b>Constant</b> <b>(5th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>; <b>(1st)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=65">detect alignment</a></u></i> (evil or good only)<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Change Shape</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=127"><u>polymorph</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) The marid can take on the appearance of any water elemental or humanoid. This ability doesn’t change the marid’s Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Rush of Water</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=165"><u>water</a></u>) The marid releases a jet of water in a 60-foot line, dealing 9d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed 10 feet (20 feet on a critical failure). The marid can’t use Rush of Water again for 1d4 rounds.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Skewer</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  The marid makes a trident Strike, dealing an extra 2d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit (4d6 on a critical hit).</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Marid Shanzadas</h3>Marid shahzadas grant wishes in ways that amuse them. They add the following to their innate spells: <b>5th</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=47"><i>cone of cold</i> (at will)</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=158"><i>illusory creature</i> (×2)</a>.<h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=50">Genie</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=212">Djinni</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=214">Efreeti</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=211">Janni</a></td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=215">Marid</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=213">Shaitan</a></td><td>7</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=50">Genie</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 162</i></a><br />A unique type of genie exists for each Elemental Plane, and the bodies of genies are formed out of elemental matter corresponding to their native plane: djinn are formed from wind, clouds, and storms; efreet are fire made flesh; marids are beings of water; and shaitans are composed of metal, gems, and stone. Lastly, the jann are formed out of all four elements, and are the weakest of geniekind. <h2 class="title">Genie Nobles</h2> Genie nobles with titles unique to their kind (as detailed in each sidebar) rule genie society. Genie nobles are generally at least 5 levels higher than a typical example of their kind. In addition to the increased statistics afforded by their higher levels, genie nobles gain additional spells. But the most wondrous (and notorious) of a genie noble’s powers is their ability to grant wishes. Any genie noble (save for jann, who lack this power) can grant a mortal or undead creature up to three wishes within a year’s time. Many unscrupulous creatures compel genie nobles to serve them, tricking them or entrapping them with magic. However, once a genie noble grants a third wish to a single creature, they are freed from service to that creature forever.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
